content: Which two U.S Presidents served during the Vietnam War era?

The two U.S. Presidents who served during the Vietnam War era were Lyndon B. Johnson and Richard Nixon. The war began in the 1950s and continued until 1975, but it was during the presidencies of Johnson and Nixon that U.S. involvement was at its peak. Lyndon B. Johnson escalated U.S. military involvement in Vietnam, while Richard Nixon eventually oversaw the U.S. withdrawal from the conflict.
